This is my cousin and I need 2 more of the booklet cards 1888 N79 History of Poor Boys Russell Alexander Alger. I am willing to pay 25.00 each for this card. The card is a little larger than a T206
the item looks like this:
[URL=http://s923.photobucket.com/user/waynea432/media/family/6ec4ce49-6d26-4d24-a95d-f922f2bd56ee_zpsxxm0sts4.jpg.html][IMG]http://i923.photobucket.com/albums/ad76/waynea432/family/6ec4ce49-6d26-4d24-a95d-f922f2bd56ee_zpsxxm0sts4.jpg[/IMG][/URL]

and I need a card in Better condition of and willing to pay $20.00 for 1888 Presidential Possibilities 
[URL=http://s923.photobucket.com/user/waynea432/media/family/img001_zpslrb5z99o.jpg.html][IMG]http://i923.photobucket.com/albums/ad76/waynea432/family/img001_zpslrb5z99o.jpg[/IMG][/URL]
[URL=http://s923.photobucket.com/user/waynea432/media/family/img002_zpsvcrsut1r.jpg.html][IMG]http://i923.photobucket.com/albums/ad76/waynea432/family/img002_zpsvcrsut1r.jpg[/IMG][/URL]

I also need 2 more PSA graded 3 or or better for a T69 John Aldens House and willing to pay 20.00 each. The Reason John Alden is my 8th Grandpa :He was a signatory to the Mayflower Compact. He married fellow Mayflower passenger Priscilla Mullins, whose entire family perished in the first winter. He served in a number of important government positions such as Assistant Governor, Duxbury Deputy to the General Court of Plymouth, Captain Myles Standish's Duxbury militia company, a member of the Council of War, Treasurer of Plymouth Colony, and Commissioner to Yarmouth.

Card looks like this:
T69 Helmar, Historic Homes, 1910, John Aldens House, PSA 3 VG

will pay by paypal or money order.

Thank you in advance for your help

still looking for more
These are Tobacco cards I am looking for
